subject: Self Care
title: Physical Discomfort While Sitting
description: One-minute skill: Physical Discomfort While Sitting.

hook.text: Your knee aches. Your back stiffens. Suddenly all you can think about is how uncomfortable sitting is.

buildup.text: Physical discomfort is one of the top reasons beginners quit. It feels like meditation is punishing them.

discovery.text: You don't need a perfect posture. A chair, a cushion, even lying down works. Comfort enables practice.

twist.text: Mild discomfort can be observed mindfully. But real pain is a signal to move. Meditation isn't endurance.

climax.text: Adjust your position freely. The body matters. No tradition is worth chronic pain for a practice about peace.

punchline.text: Sit however you need to. Then just begin.

quiz.question: Do you need to sit cross-legged to meditate properly?
options: No ‚Äî a chair, cushion, or lying down all work
